item.title: 2 Minute Omelette in a Mug
item.description: Time of preparation Preparation Cook Total 3 mins 2 mins 5 mins Ingredients 2 to 3 eggs 1 Tbsp of ham or precooked meat, diced 1 Tbsp of salsa 1 Tbsp shredded cheese olive oil or cooking spray salt and pepper Instructions Coat your mug with olive oil or cooking spray. Add eggs to mug and whisk together with a fork Add diced meat, salsa, cheese, salt and pepper.

item.title: A warm and creamy porridge
item.description: Time of preparation Preparation Cook Total 1 mins 10 mins 11 mins Ingredients 1⁄2 cup rolled oats (not instant). 1 1⁄3 cup full cream milk (or almond milk or coconut milk if you prefer). 1⁄4 teaspoon ground cinnamon. pinch salt. 1 tablespoon pepitas (preferably activated),optional. 2 tablespoons coconut flakes, optional. Instructions Combine oats, milk, cinnamon and salt in a small saucepan.

item.title: Avo-Tahini Toast
item.description: Time of preparation Preparation Cook Total 10 mins 0 mins 10 mins Ingredients 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice Dash of kosher salt 1⁄2 ripe peeled avocado 1 (1-oz.) slice whole-grain bread, toasted 3 grape tomatoes, quartered 2 pitted kalamata olives, chopped 1 hard-cooked large egg, peeled and sliced 1 teaspoon tahini (sesame paste) Instructions Combine juice, salt, and avocado in a bowl, mashing with a fork.

item.title: Raspberry Banana Smoothie
item.description: Time of preparation Preparation Cook Total 5 mins 0 mins 5 mins Ingredients 3 very ripe bananas, cut into chunks, frozen 1⁄2 cup frozen raspberries 1 cup SILK almond milk 1⁄2 cup fresh orange juice (preferably no sugar added) 2 tablespoons raw honey (more to taste, if desired) Instructions Place all of the ingredients in a blender and pulse until smooth, about 30 seconds.

item.title: Simple Blackberry Chia Pudding
item.description: Time of preparation Preparation Cook Total 2 mins 10 mins 12 mins Ingredients 1 Tbsp chia seeds 1 Tbsp plain yoghurt 2 Tbsp blackberries 0.25 tsp maple syrup a tiny splash of vanilla extract Instructions Place the chia seeds, yoghurt, milk, maple syrup, blackberries, and vanilla into a jar (for the large batch I find a one-liter wide-mouth mason jar works perfectly) and stir well.
